info.description:
Retrieves standard analytical data for one or more securities. 

# Description

Security Analytics are the standard set of analytics generated by Aladdin®'s risk calculator for each instrument, price, and date. The Security Analytics API retrieves precomputed analytics, such as duration details, for the given asset ids. When successful, the API will return one entry for each currency relevant to the assets specified. When analytics are not available for a particular asset, that asset will be absent from the results.

## Example Use Case

  The Security Analytics API could be used as an input to a client's bespoke portfolio modeling, analytics, or construction process off of Aladdin®.

## Implementation Status

This API is production ready. For information on versioning, please see the [Developer Guide].

  [Developer Guide]: apps/aladdin-developer-portal/#/guides/developer-guide
info.title: Security Analytics 2.0

parameters.description: The Aladdin® risk hierarchy to determine risk analytics for this asset. Defaults to `RISK` if not specified.
parameters.name: riskHierarchy

parameters.description: The date to get risk for, expressed as an ISO 8601/RFC3339 full-date, in the format: `YYYY-MM-DD`. Defaults to `T-1` if not specified.
parameters.name: riskDate

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, expressed as an ISO 8601/RFC3339 UTC date-time (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ) or an RFC7231 HTTP-date format (E, d M YYYY hh:mm:ss GMT)
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description: Optional date tolerance for risk and option delta if the data is not populated on the risk date, expressed as an Integer
parameters.name: dateTolerance

200.description: Security Analytics response object if request is successful.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.

400.description: Aladdin® will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in “HTTP-date” format as defined by RFC 7231.

401.description: Aladdin® will not process the request as the necessary credentials were not provided or were invalid.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in “HTTP-date” format as defined by RFC 7231.

403.description: Aladdin® understood the request but is refusing to authorize it.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in “HTTP-date” format as defined by RFC 7231.

404.description: Aladdin® did not find the resource requested or is unwilling to disclose if it exists. Could indicate a defect in the client program or data which is no longer accessible.

VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the client to the request that originated this response.

VND.com.blackrock.Response-ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this response

VND.com.blackrock.Response-Timestamp.description: Timestamp assigned to this response, in “HTTP-date” format as defined by RFC 7231.

errors.description: These are the Asset Ids which were not processed.

riskByAssetId.description: Map of Asset Id to security analytics

code.description: A short mnenomic reference code for the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

RiskAnalytics.description: Aladdin Analytics data. Each entry is a map of risk data.

SecurityAnalytics.description: Aladdin Security Analytics,a map of currency to Risk Analytics

riskByCurrency.description: Map of ISO Currency code or `ALL` to risk analytics.

aSpread.description: Static spread to LIBOR at WAL point.

accruedInterest.description: Accrued interest is a date-sensitive attribute that factors into valuation. In general, the calculation is an interpolation of coupon values for the desired date between two coupon reset dates.

alternateOac.description: OAC computed using the specified alternate discount curve

alternateOad.description: OAD computed using the specified alternate discount curve

alternateOas.description: The Option Adjusted Spread of a security is quoted in basis points. It is the average spread of a security over its entire respective curve after factoring out the embedded option value. Alt (Alternative) OAS would utilize a different curve than the default curve used e.g., Libor vs Treasury.

alternateStaticSpread.description: Static spread computed using the specificed alternate discount curve (E Spread when the alternate curve is Libor)

alternateZeroVolSpread.description: Zero volatility spread computed using the specified alternate discount curve

assetId.description: Aladdin's unique ID for an asset. An asset ID may also be assigned to a portfolio or an index.

atTheMoneyRate.description: At-the-money rate for the underlying of the swaption, cap or floor

atTheMoneyVolatility.description: At-the-money volatility for the underlying of the swaption, cap or floor

basisSpreadDuration.description: Sensitivity of a security's price with respect to changes in the spread between different tenored rates

benchmarkOtr.description: Tenor of the on-the-run government bond with a maturity closest to the WAL of a given security

bondFloor.description: Theoretical value of bond if equity price goes to zero

breakevenCDSSpread.description: For CDS, the deal spread that will reprice the CDS to zero. For bonds, the cost of buying protection through a new CDS contract assuming equal matuirty and recovery rate to this bond

cbeHror.description: Horizon rate of return (in bond equivalent terms)

cdsImpliedPrice.description: For CDS, present value as computed by the reduced form model.  For bonds, present value computed by discounting the default adjusted cash flows at LIBOR

cdsMarketSpread.description: Calculated as Breakeven CDS Spread - Par Asset Swap Spread

cdsSpreadDuration.description: Sensitivity of a credit instrument's price to changes in the issuer CDS curve

convexity.description: Convexity of the security at the time of trade.

coverageRatio.description: Ratio of remaining losses in the BE Multiplier case to the remaining losses in the base case. A coverage ratio greater than one implies the bond is not experiencing principal losses in the base case. A coverage ratio less than one implies the bond is experiencing principal losses in the base case

cumulativeLossPct.description: Total loss amount for the collateral groups paying to the bond (including historical and projected losses) as a percent of original balance

cumulativeLossPctCrossGroup.description: Cumulative loss percentage of loans cross-collateralizing the bond

currency.description: The currency's ISO code, e.g. USD, EUR, NOK, SGD, etc. This is widely available externally. For list in Aladdin, see the B_CURRENCY decode.

defaultAdjustedDuration.description: Sensitivity of a corporate bond's price to changes in interest rates while holding the Default Adjusted Spread constant

defaultAdjustedSpread.description: Spread of the corporate bond after adjusting its cash flows for default probabilities implied from the issuer's CDS curve (holding the base recovery constant)

defaultAdjustedYield.description: Yield calculated using default adjusted cash flows

discountCurve.description: Curve used to discount projected cash flows

eqDown.description: Fixed equity price shock down in %

eqUp.description: Fixed equity price shock up in %

forwardFxRate.description: Forward FX rate corresponding to the maturity of the instrument

fxBasisDuration.description: Sensitivity of an FX instrument's price to changes in FX basis spread

horizonDays.description: Number of days used for the horizon rate of return calculations

iSpread.description: Yield spread to the OTR Government curve at WAL point, where the curve is constructed using the exact maturities of the OTR bonds

inflationConvexity.description: Sensitivity of an inflation-linked instrument's price to changes in inflation expectations unaccounted for by Inflation Duration

inflationDuration.description: Sensitivity of an inflation-linked instrument's price to changes in inflation expectations. Calculated by shocking the inflation curve while holding nominal rates constant

interestRateModel.description: BlackRock model used to project interest rate paths

interestShortfall.description: Difference between the interest due and the interest actually paid, less servicer advances

interestWal.description: Weighted average life of the interest cash flow stream

jSpread.description: Static spread to LIBOR at WAL point.

krd3m.description: krd3m. Key Rate Durations are calculated in the same way as effective duration. However, instead of shifting the entire yield curve parallel, only individual sections of the yield curve are shocked. The key point shocked on the yield curve here is 3m.

localOas.description: For Eurozone bonds, OAS computed with respect to the local government curve

maturity.description: The end date of any security. For non-notional securities, this is the date on which the original principal amount becomes due and payable. Otherwise known as the "legal final maturity." For perpetual securities, enter 12/31/2049 as the maturity (Aladdin convention). This field can also represent the end date of any credit enhancements.

maturityToWorst.description: Maturity date corresponding to the (worst) yield outcome

modelConvexity.description: Unadjusted option adjusted convexity.  For inflation-linked securities, this is the real convexity

modelDuration.description: Unadjusted option adjusted duration.  For inflation-linked securities, this is the real duration

modifiedDurationToWorst.description: Modified duration calculated using the (worst) scenario cash flows

mortgageDuration.description: Sensitivity of a mortgage security's price to the mortgage rate and discounting. For a fixed-rate mortgage, the mortgage duration is equal to the OAD

mortgageRateDuration.description: Sensitivity of a mortgage security's price to a parallel shift in all mortgage rates used in the prepayment model

mortgageTreasuryBasisDuration.description: Sensitivity of a security's price to changes in the spread between current coupon MBS (the 'par coupon', the coupon of a theoretical TBA priced at par) and the blended rate

nSpread.description: Static spread to LIBOR at WAL point.

nextCallDate.description: Next call date, expressed as an ISO 8601/RFC3339 full-date, in the following format YYYY-MM-DD

nominalYield.description: Annualized nominal yield assuming the security is held to maturity (calculated using market convention)

normalVolDuration.description: Sensitivity of a security's price to changes in normal volatility

numberOfPaths.description: Number of paths used in the simulation

oac.description: Option adjusted convexity (OAC) is the 2nd order approximation of the price-rate relationship. It measures the sensitivity of price to parallel yield curve shifts unaccounted for by duration. The option-adjusted convexity may vary from negative to positive.

oad.description: Option Adjusted Duration (OAD) is the percentage change in the instrument’s price given 1% shift to interest rates. It measures the sensitivity of the market price to parallel shifts in the yield curve; assuming OAS stays constant as the curve shifts after adjusting for any embedded options.

oas.description: Option-Adjusted Spread (OAS) is the single spread that is added on top of the risk-free rate to equate a bond’s present value to the market price. OAS is typically a fixed income credit risk metric and is not relevant for futures, options, swaps, and other derivatives

oisLiborDuration.description: Sensitivity of a security's price with respect to changes in the OIS-Libor spread. Computed by shocking only OIS rates while holding LIBOR rates constant

optionDelta.description: Sensitivity of option premium to change in the underlying price

optionDeltaAlt.description: Contract delta: Equity exposure of the convertible bond

optionImpliedVolatility.description: Implied volaility used to price the option, quoted in absolute terms

optionPhi.description: Change in option premium per change in foreign interest rates (FX) or dividends (Equity)

optionRho.description: Change in option premium per change in domestic interest rate

optionTheta.description: Sensitivity of option premium to the passage of time

optionThetaClean.description: Theta Clean: Time sensitivity (without coupon effect)

optionValue.description: Value of the embedded option in a security (calculated as Zero Volatility Spread - OAS)

optionVanna.description: Change in vega due to change in underlying price or change in delta due to change in underlying volatility

optionVega.description: Sensitivity of option premium to changes in volatility

optionVolga.description: Sensitivity of vega to changes in volatility

parAssetSwapSpread.description: Spread on the pay leg of an asset swap on this bond that will force the swap's price to zero.

parOac.description: OAC computed by shocking the par yield curve

parOad.description: OAD computed by shocking the par yield curve

payDiscountFactor.description: Discount factor for the pay leg

prepayDuration.description: Sensitivity of a mortgage security's price to changes in prepayments. Calculated by running valuations at speeds that are 25% faster and slower than baseline prepayment model speeds while holding OAS constant

prepayModel.description: BlackRock model used to project prepayments.

principalLoss.description: Amount of principal lost on the bond as a percent of current face

principalWal.description: Weighted average life of the principal cash flow stream

pssDuration.description: Sensitivity of a mortgage security's price to the spread between the primary and secondary mortgage rates

purpose.description: Purpose combined with CODE defines a unique set of aliases.

realDuration.description: Price sensitivity to changes in interest rates taking into account historic inflation but assuming zero future inflation

receiveDiscountFactor.description: Discount factor for the receive leg

recoveryRate.description: Recovery rate in the event of default

recoveryRateDuration.description: Sensitivity of a credit instrument's price to changes in the pricing recovery rate

remainingLiqPct.description: Percentage of the current collateral pool balance that we project will default before maturity

remainingLossPct.description: Projected losses on the collateral groups paying to the bond as a percent of current balance

remainingLossPctCrossGroup.description: Remaining loss percentage of loans cross-collateralizing the bond

solvencyEquityType1Sensitivity.description: Solvency Equity Type 1 price change between original and shocked full reval price

solvencyEquityType2Sensitivity.description: Solvency Equity Type 2 price change between original and shocked full reval price

solvencyInterestRateDownDuration.description: Price sensitivity to interest rate down shock

solvencyInterestRateUpDuration.description: Price sensitivity to interest rate up shock

spreadConvexity.description: Sensitivity of a security's price to changes in its OAS unaccounted for by Spread Duration

spreadDur.description: Spread Duration is the sensitivity of the bond’s market price with change in spreads.

staticSpread.description: Constant yield spread above the discount curve (by default Treasury) which equates the price of the bond to the present value of its cash flows in the nominal scenario

streetYield.description: Yield calculated assuming zero historical and future inflation (so assuming zero inflation since inception of the security)

wal.description: The weighted average life (WAL) is the average length of time that each dollar of unpaid principal on a loan, or an amortizing bond remains outstanding.

walEquivalentCpr.description: Single CPR rate that yields the same average life as the selected econometric prepayment model

walEquivalentPsa.description: Single PSA rate that yields the same average life as the selected econometric prepayment model

walOfLosses.description: Weighted average life of the of the loss cash flow stream

walToMaturity.description: Weighted-average time to the return of a dollar of principal

walToWorst.description: WAL calculated using the (worst) scenario cash flows

yieldToWorst.description: Lowest potential yield that can be received by a bond given calls, puts, prepayments and sinking funds. For inflation-linked securities this is the real yield

zSpread.description: Yield spread to the OTR Government curve

zeroVolMaturity.description: Expected maturity of a security in the forward scenario

zeroVolModifiedDuration.description: Modified duration calculated assuming cash flows follow the forward scenario

zeroVolWal.description: WAL calculated assuming cash flows follow the forward scenario
